content.text: On the Test Results List Screen
On the Test Results Detail Screen
Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version)
Notes @March 14, 2023 Notes @March 7, 2023 Notes @March 3, 2023 Notes @February 22, 2023 Notes @February 14, 2023 Notes @February 8, 2023

Users will often create steps in their tests which require the creation of new user or other data within a test scenario, however after a test is complete users do not want this created data to stay. They want to cleanup data that is showing up on their UI and can be deleted from the frontend. They are mainly concerned with changing ID's and not having those UI elements sticking around.
Currently the internal Cleanup steps feature works as follows -

We had 3 customers give us specific feedback with needs regarding cleanup steps and decided not to go with us because of it. I think we could have closed at least 2 more customers for $900 MRR with some more features to solve these issues.
Current number of requests on Productboard -
Cleanup steps will be displayed in a separate section below the regular steps in a scenario
Tooltips to be shown in the Cleanup steps section as per the design.
The insert (+) menu will be functional in the Cleanup steps sections
Users should be able to mark steps and copy/paste as cleanup steps from the scenario editor screen.
Marked steps will go to the beginning of the Cleanup steps section.
Steps which should NOT be able to be
Users should be able to unmark cleanup steps back to regular steps
Unmarked steps are added to the end of the regular steps
Users can rearrange clean up steps within the Cleanup steps section
Users can drag and drop steps into the Cleanup steps section
An error modal should be displayed if the users tries to drag and drop steps which cannot be marked as Cleanup Steps
Users can drag and drop Cleanup steps back to the regular step sequence
On the scenario edit screen the total number of steps counter should be broken down into regular and cleanup steps on mouseover
A visit step can be selected but the only options would be to mark/unmark as a cleanup step.
Add an Options tab to the scenario editor screen. Options tab will allow control of Cleanup Steps, Data tab and Variables tab being viewable or hidden.
If there are any active Cleanups Steps, Data or Variables the hide toggle will be disabled.
Cleanup steps to be able to export values
If all regular steps pass the local reply will continue and replay the Cleanup steps.
If any regular steps fail the replay will stop and any Cleanup steps will not be executed.
Scenarios with active Cleanup steps should show a Cleanup icon
If a cleanup step fails in a test execution it should result in that test showing as failed.
Tests with cleanup steps should show them in a separate section in the test results detail screen, below the regular steps.
If test with a Cleanup steps fails during any of the non-cleanup up steps, the cleanup steps should still be executed.
If the cleanup steps cannot be executed a specific error message should be shown in test results (same error detail as if a regular step failed now in the current UI)
The feature should have a toggle to be enabled/disabled in Autify admin as per the new pricing plan requirements.
The cleanup steps checkbox on the options tab will not be visible
Any existing cleanup steps will not be visible in scenario editor
Any tests run that had cleanup steps before disabling will skip the Cleanup steps part during execution
Previous test runs with cleanup steps will still be visible in test results detail screen.
As a user, I want to convert the recorded steps into the cleanup steps
As a user, I want to see the cleanup steps execution result in the test scenario results page
(note: if you cannot view the design, please request access) Last updated: 2/22/23
Data staging / before hook ( __cleanup__ ), we will focus on the __cleanup_only__ as in the existing cleanup functionality.
Cleanup steps can be in the middle of a scenario
Toggle cleanup steps in the recorder
Cleanup steps inside a step group
Step groups can be marked as cleanup steps
Workspace manager and editor would have access to all functionality in this feature.
Number of customers with cleanup steps enabled
Number of scenarios with cleanup steps enabled
The feature is used by 10% of eligible customers after 3 months
Any Feedback received from current and demo customers about this feature.
Scenarios with Cleanup steps see increased run frequency over non-cleanup scenarios
Add a is_cleanup bool field default false on the steps table
Add an "options" jsonb field on scenarios table to contain the display options described in PRD
Return that field on the related types and arguments (scenario types + step related ones)
Ensure that the newly created fields are properly added / managed on scenario history / duplicate
Change Main.json generation code so that we can add the clean up flag for each steps ( in the case we use SGA, are we supposed to
segregate steps that have the cleanup step flag set to false/true
False => normal step to be executed.
True => clean up steps that have to be executed during the cleanups
segregate steps that have the cleanup step flag set to false/true (they will be returned as a single list)
True => display as clean up steps
To avoid breaking the step numbers displayed in test case results. Once we move a step in the cleanup section, we consider them moved somewhere at the end of the step list.
Steps Arguments sent to the mutation:
If we move step 3 to clean up step these 3 arrays will look like follow
Steps Arguments sent to the mutation:
Formatting and display in test case result
Do we count the execution in the case of an internal error on clean up step
Still not sure how we want to handle SGA (we could say that if an sga is put in cleanup all subsequent steps are marked as cleanup only for this scenario)
Feature toggle manageable within the scenario (show clean up steps)
What are the cleanup tickets we need to create
Check whether bug bash is required or not
It changes the content of existing items
New or changed terminology has been added
Decide the name of the function
It will be a paid option?
It requires users to be logged out
It requires users some tasks such as clearing cache or recreating scenarios
It introduces any other visible changes
(If any of "Documentation" item was checked) The name of the feature of the page has defined (Both in Japanese and English)
There is a draft for the announcement
Whether or not to hide the feature by default:
Separate the Cleanup steps in scenario view to a separate section
Add ability to hide Cleanup steps section from scenario view
Remove the mark all scenario as Cleanup steps as there is no added usefulness in this feature shown as normal in a separate section
Remove the new Cleanup failed badge, tests with failed cleanup steps will just be marked as failed as per regular steps failing
In the future will add a new column to the test results list to give a failure reason so a new badge is not needed.
Cleanup steps in the test results page detail screen will not be collapsable just
We need to add some guide or a link to documentation on the page so users can understand how cleanup steps work
It's likely that cleanup steps do not work as expected when they don't start with go-to steps
Customers may want to replay & record only cleanup steps
In a sense, cleanup step groups might work better than cleanup steps built in a scenario
How can we design the feature to expand it in the future for marking groups of steps with different execution rules?
Functional UI to highlight new features
What if all a user creates an all clean up scenario?
Can we mark tests as specific with "cleanup failed" rather than just failed.
Cleanup steps can be added in run in the middle of scenarios or not?
Should the ability to toggle cleanup steps be included in the recorder for initial scope?

# **Cleanup Steps** | Created | December 16, 2022 2
55 PM | | |----------------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--| | Last
Edited Time | June 12, 2024 4
21 PM | | | Status | Released 🎉 | | | Created
By | Nicholas Carter | | | Last
Edited By | Nicholas Carter | | | Stakeholders | Haruhiko Kubo
Meiko Hori
Samuel Ostrom
Ryota Nishimura | | | Label | Web | | | Design
Link | https://www.figma.com/file/RWXxw9wcjN9zEivDPeBcOl/Clean-up
Steps?node-id=1%3A64&t=1CwFX9v9Be46NnoC-1 | | | Proposal
Doc | https://www.notion.so/autifyhq/Clean-up-Steps
49c682c3996745c7b7979795a11c7967 | | | Overview/Problem Statement | | | | Value Proposition | | | | Requirements | On the Scenario Details Screen | | | | | | | On the Scenario List Screen
On the Test Results List Screen | | | | | | | | On the Test Results Detail Screen
On Autify Admin | | | | Happy Path | | | | DESIGN MOCKUPS | | | | Not in Scope | | | | User Role Permissions | | | | Success Metrics/Data | | | | Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version) | | | | Release Timelines and Estimates | | | | Checklist for QA team | | | | Checklist for CS team | | | | Documentation | | | | | :
: | | [Checklist for Marketing&Sales](#page-8-0) [Announcement](#page-8-1) [Release](#page-8-2) [Other checklist](#page-8-3) [Notes](#page-9-0) @[August 29, 2023](#page-9-0) Notes @March 14, 2023 Notes @March 7, 2023 Notes @March 3, 2023 Notes @February 22, 2023 Notes @February 14, 2023 Notes @February 8, 2023 ## **Overview/Problem Statement** Users will often create steps in their tests which require the creation of new user or other data within a test scenario, however after a test is complete users do not want this created data to stay. They want to cleanup data that is showing up on their UI and can be deleted from the frontend. They are mainly concerned with changing ID's and not having those UI elements sticking around. Currently the internal Cleanup steps feature works as follows - How to use Cleanup ## **Value Proposition** We had 3 customers give us specific feedback with needs regarding cleanup steps and decided not to go with us because of it. I think we could have closed at least 2 more customers for \$900 MRR with some more features to solve these issues. Current number of requests on Productboard - [30](https://autify.productboard.com/feature-board/3548337-feature-prioritization/features/10590582/insights) # **Requirements** ### **On the Scenario Details Screen** Cleanup steps will be displayed in a separate section below the regular steps in a scenario Tooltips to be shown in the Cleanup steps section as per the design. The insert (+) menu will be functional in the Cleanup steps sections Users should be able to mark steps and copy/paste as cleanup steps from the scenario editor screen. - Marked steps will go to the beginning of the Cleanup steps section. - Steps which should NOT be able to be **marked or pasted** as Cleanup steps - Element should look the same - Step Groups or SGA Users should be able to unmark cleanup steps back to regular steps Unmarked steps are added to the end of the regular steps Users can rearrange clean up steps within the Cleanup steps section Users can drag and drop steps into the Cleanup steps section An error modal should be displayed if the users tries to drag and drop steps which cannot be marked as Cleanup Steps Users can drag and drop Cleanup steps back to the regular step sequence On the scenario edit screen the total number of steps counter should be broken down into regular and cleanup steps on mouseover A visit step can be selected but the only options would be to mark/unmark as a cleanup step. Add an Options tab to the scenario editor screen. Options tab will allow control of Cleanup Steps, Data tab and Variables tab being viewable or hidden. If there are any active Cleanups Steps, Data or Variables the hide toggle will be disabled. Cleanup steps to be able to export values For local replay - If all regular steps pass the local reply will continue and replay the Cleanup steps. - If any regular steps fail the replay will stop and any Cleanup steps will not be executed. ### **On the Scenario List Screen** Scenarios with active Cleanup steps should show a Cleanup icon ### **On the Test Results List Screen** If a cleanup step fails in a test execution it should result in that test showing as failed. Using the existing failed icon ### **On the Test Results Detail Screen** Tests with cleanup steps should show them in a separate section in the test results detail screen, below the regular steps. If test with a Cleanup steps fails during any of the non-cleanup up steps, the cleanup steps should still be executed. If the cleanup steps cannot be executed a specific error message should be shown in test results (same error detail as if a regular step failed now in the current UI) ### **On Autify Admin** The feature should have a toggle to be enabled/disabled in Autify admin as per the new pricing plan requirements. - If disabled in admin - The cleanup steps checkbox on the options tab will not be visible - Any existing cleanup steps will not be visible in scenario editor - Any tests run that had cleanup steps before disabling will skip the Cleanup steps part during execution - Previous test runs with cleanup steps will still be visible in test results detail screen. ### **Happy Path** - As a user, I want to convert the recorded steps into the cleanup steps - As a user, I want to see the cleanup steps execution result in the test scenario results page ### **DESIGN MOCKUPS** [https://www.figma.com/file/RWXxw9wcjN9zEivDPeBcOl/Clean-](https://www.figma.com/file/RWXxw9wcjN9zEivDPeBcOl/Clean-up-Steps?node-id=1%3A64&t=JG5QZr7lHWHMq1Lq-1) [up-Steps?node](https://www.figma.com/file/RWXxw9wcjN9zEivDPeBcOl/Clean-up-Steps?node-id=1%3A64&t=JG5QZr7lHWHMq1Lq-1)[id=1%3A64&t=JG5QZr7lHWHMq1Lq-1](https://www.figma.com/file/RWXxw9wcjN9zEivDPeBcOl/Clean-up-Steps?node-id=1%3A64&t=JG5QZr7lHWHMq1Lq-1) (note: if you cannot view the design, please request access) Last updated: 2/22/23 https://www.figma.com/file/RWXxw 9wcjN9zEivDPeBcOl/Clean-up-Ste ps?node-id=0%3A1&t=JG5QZr7lH WHMq1Lq-1 #### ZEPLIN ### **Not in Scope** - Data staging / before hook ( \_\_cleanup\_\_ ), we will focus on the \_\_cleanup\_only\_\_ as in the existing cleanup functionality. - Cleanup steps can be in the middle of a scenario - Toggle cleanup steps in the recorder - Cleanup steps inside a step group - Step groups can be marked as cleanup steps # **User Role Permissions** - Workspace manager and editor would have access to all functionality in this feature. - User Roles Permission Matrix - [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mdXM7kOSGYbrWY2](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mdXM7kOSGYbrWY2-kZGF6FFA6OIBsrimSd8gA2KgEUU/edit#gid=613193027&range=B13) [kZGF6FFA6OIBsrimSd8gA2KgEUU/edit#gid=613193027&range=B13](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mdXM7kOSGYbrWY2-kZGF6FFA6OIBsrimSd8gA2KgEUU/edit#gid=613193027&range=B13) ## **Success Metrics/Data** - Number of created cleanup steps - Number of customers with cleanup steps enabled - Number of scenarios with cleanup steps enabled - Outcome Metrics - The feature is used by 10% of eligible customers after 3 months - Any Feedback received from current and demo customers about this feature. - Scenarios with Cleanup steps see increased run frequency over non-cleanup scenarios # **Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version)** ### **Clean up steps, Core implementation (register update and execute cleanup steps)** #### **Database:** - Add a is\_cleanup bool field default false on the steps table - Add an "options" jsonb field on scenarios table to contain the display options described in PRD ### **Web backend:** - Return that field on the related types and arguments (scenario types + step related ones) - Ensure that the newly created fields are properly added / managed on scenario history / duplicate - Change Main.json generation code so that we can add the clean up flag for each steps ( in the case we use SGA, are we supposed to #### **Worker:** segregate steps that have the cleanup step flag set to false/true False => normal step to be executed. True => clean up steps that have to be executed during the cleanups ### **Web frontend:** segregate steps that have the cleanup step flag set to false/true (they will be returned as a single list) False => display as normal steps True => display as clean up steps To avoid breaking the step numbers displayed in test case results. Once we move a step in the cleanup section, we consider them moved somewhere at the end of the step list. eg: Step list: - Step 1 - Step 2 - Step 3 - Step 4 Clean up step list: Clean up step 1 Steps Arguments sent to the mutation: - Step 1 - Step 2 - Step 3 - Step 4 - Clean up step 1 If we move step 3 to clean up step these 3 arrays will look like follow Step list: - Step 1 - Step 2 - Step 4 Clean up step list: - Clean up step 1 - Step 3 Steps Arguments sent to the mutation: - Step 1 - Step 2 - Step 4 - Clean up step 1 - Step 3 ### **Things not addressed:** - Formatting and display in test case result - Do we count the execution in the case of an internal error on clean up step - Still not sure how we want to handle SGA (we could say that if an sga is put in cleanup all subsequent steps are marked as cleanup only for this scenario) - Feature toggle manageable within the scenario (show clean up steps) - What are the cleanup tickets we need to create # **Release Timelines and Estimates** - Roadmap Schedule Q3 2023 - Design Estimate - - Engineering Estimate 5 sprints [Cleanup Steps: Rough Time Estimate](https://www.notion.so/Cleanup-Steps-Rough-Time-Estimate-e0ac287399e047889af858aba00736e3?pvs=21) \*\*Updated after design change (3/17) # **Checklist for QA team** - Review the user stories - Check whether bug bash is required or not # **Checklist for CS team** ### **Documentation** - It's a new feature - It introduces new pages - It changes the existing pages ![](_page_8_Picture_0.jpeg) - It changes the content of existing items - It changes the current flow - New or changed terminology has been added # **Checklist for Marketing&Sales** ![](_page_8_Picture_5.jpeg) ![](_page_8_Picture_6.jpeg) - Need sales deck - Need a page on website - Need talk script - Decide the name of the function - It will be a paid option? - Yes - No ### **Announcement** - It requires a down time - It requires users to be logged out - It requires users some tasks such as clearing cache or recreating scenarios - It introduces any other visible changes ### **Release** - Release behind a feature flag - Release as Public beta - Normal release # **Other checklist** (If any of "Documentation" item was checked) The name of the feature of the page has defined (Both in Japanese and English) There is a draft for the announcement ## **Notes** Whether or not to hide the feature by default: https://autifyhq.slack.com/archives/CV1NGMXEG/p1693298370148449 #### **Notes @March 14, 2023** - New Design - - How to show/hide cleanup steps #### **Notes @March 7, 2023** #### [Cleanup Steps: UX chat](https://www.notion.so/Cleanup-Steps-UX-chat-61dd1c3faeec4885aee5e69d9b640430?pvs=21) - Changes/Simplifications based on above discussion - Separate the Cleanup steps in scenario view to a separate section - Add better feature introduction/tooltips - Add ability to hide Cleanup steps section from scenario view - Remove the mark all scenario as Cleanup steps as there is no added usefulness in this feature shown as normal in a separate section **@August 29, 2023** - Remove the new Cleanup failed badge, tests with failed cleanup steps will just be marked as failed as per regular steps failing - In the future will add a new column to the test results list to give a failure reason so a new badge is not needed. - Cleanup steps in the test results page detail screen will not be collapsable just #### **Notes @March 3, 2023** - Additional issues to consider - We need to add some guide or a link to documentation on the page so users can understand how cleanup steps work - It's likely that cleanup steps do not work as expected when they don't start with go-to steps - Customers may want to replay & record only cleanup steps - In a sense, cleanup step groups might work better than cleanup steps built in a scenario #### **Notes @February 22, 2023** Meeting recording - https://us02web.zoom.us/rec/share/PMxHyvNKkVechDc3UtD4ejWUW472eJXNjMY Passcode: 3v8ge3.B #### **Notes @February 14, 2023** How can we design the feature to expand it in the future for marking groups of steps with different execution rules? Functional UI to highlight new features What if all a user creates an all clean up scenario? #### **Notes @February 8, 2023** Can we mark tests as specific with "cleanup failed" rather than just failed. Cleanup steps can be added in run in the middle of scenarios or not? Should the ability to toggle cleanup steps be included in the recorder for initial scope?

issues.description: The document lacks specific details on how the requirements should be implemented, which can lead to ambiguity during development and testing.
issues.resolution: Add detailed implementation guidelines and examples for each requirement to ensure clarity and consistency during development and testing.

issues.description: The 'Overview/Problem Statement' section is empty, which is crucial for understanding the context and purpose of the product requirements.
issues.resolution: Fill the 'Overview/Problem Statement' section with a clear and concise statement that outlines the purpose and objectives of the product requirements.

issues.description: The 'Value Proposition' section is not clearly defined, missing detailed information on the benefits or the problems the features will solve.
issues.resolution: Define the 'Value Proposition' section by detailing the specific benefits the features will provide and the problems they will solve for the users.

issues.description: The requirements for the 'On the Scenario Details Screen' are too complex and could be broken down into simpler, more specific sub-requirements for clarity.
issues.resolution: Break down the complex requirements listed under 'On the Scenario Details Screen' into simpler, more manageable sub-requirements with clear, actionable items.

issues.description: The document does not specify the behavior or requirements for error handling, other than a brief mention of an error modal, which is not sufficient for test case generation.
locations: An error modal should be displayed if the users tries to drag and drop steps which cannot be marked as Cleanup Steps (line 1-2)
issues.resolution: Expand the error handling requirements to include specific scenarios and expected behaviors, ensuring comprehensive coverage for test case generation.

issues.description: The 'Success Metrics/Data' section is vague and does not provide specific, measurable goals.
issues.resolution: Refine the 'Success Metrics/Data' section by setting specific, measurable goals and metrics to track the success and impact of the feature post-release.

issues.description: The 'Technical proposal' section refers to another document for the latest version, which can lead to inconsistencies if the external document is not synchronized.
locations: Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version) (line 1-2)
issues.resolution: Integrate the content of the external technical proposal document directly into the PRD to maintain consistency and ensure all information is accessible in one place.

issues.description: The 'Release Timelines and Estimates' section is incomplete, lacking specific dates and detailed estimates for design and engineering phases.
issues.resolution: Complete the 'Release Timelines and Estimates' section with specific dates and detailed phase-wise estimates for both design and engineering.

issues.description: The 'Documentation' section is empty, which is critical for ensuring that the feature is properly documented for end-users and internal teams.
issues.resolution: Develop comprehensive documentation for the feature, including user guides, internal process documents, and update logs to ensure proper understanding and usage.

issues.description: The PRD includes links to external resources (e.g., Figma, Google Docs) without ensuring that access is universally available or maintained, which could lead to access issues.
issues.resolution: Ensure all external links in the PRD are accessible to all stakeholders and maintain a backup of critical documents internally to prevent access issues.

suggestions.suggested_text: Each requirement should include specific implementation details, such as the expected user interactions, data flow, and integration points with other system components. For example, for the requirement 'Cleanup steps will be displayed in a separate section below the regular steps in a scenario', specify the UI changes, backend services involved, and how these changes will be reflected in the existing system architecture.
suggestions.explanation: Adding detailed implementation guidelines and examples will help eliminate ambiguity and ensure that developers and testers have a clear understanding of what needs to be built and how it integrates with the existing system.

suggestions.suggested_text: The purpose of the Cleanup Steps feature is to allow users to efficiently manage and remove temporary data created during test executions. This ensures that test environments remain clean and that data integrity is maintained across tests. The feature aims to enhance user experience by providing a seamless way to handle data cleanup post-test execution.
suggestions.explanation: Adding a clear and concise problem statement helps stakeholders understand the purpose and objectives of the Cleanup Steps feature, setting a clear context for the product requirements.

suggestions.suggested_text: The Cleanup Steps feature aims to enhance user efficiency by automating the removal of test data post-execution, thus ensuring cleaner environments and reducing manual cleanup efforts. This feature is particularly beneficial for users who run multiple tests in succession and need to ensure that each test starts with a clean state.
suggestions.explanation: The original 'Value Proposition' section was empty, lacking information on how the feature benefits the user. The suggested text clearly defines the advantages of the Cleanup Steps feature, addressing the issue identified.

suggestions.original_text:
Cleanup steps will be displayed in a separate section below the regular steps in a scenario
Tooltips to be shown in the Cleanup steps section as per the design.
The insert (+) menu will be functional in the Cleanup steps sections
Users should be able to mark steps and copy/paste as cleanup steps from the scenario editor screen.
- Marked steps will go to the beginning of the Cleanup steps section.
- Steps which should NOT be able to be marked or pasted as Cleanup steps
	- Element should look the same
	- Step Groups or SGA
Users should be able to unmark cleanup steps back to regular steps
Unmarked steps are added to the end of the regular steps
Users can rearrange clean up steps within the Cleanup steps section
Users can drag and drop steps into the Cleanup steps section
An error modal should be displayed if the users tries to drag and drop steps which cannot be marked as Cleanup Steps
Users can drag and drop Cleanup steps back to the regular step sequence
On the scenario edit screen the total number of steps counter should be broken down into regular and cleanup steps on mouseover
A visit step can be selected but the only options would be to mark/unmark as a cleanup step.
Add an Options tab to the scenario editor screen. Options tab will allow control of Cleanup Steps, Data tab and Variables tab being viewable or hidden.
If there are any active Cleanups Steps, Data or Variables the hide toggle will be disabled.
Cleanup steps to be able to export values
For local replay
- If all regular steps pass the local reply will continue and replay the Cleanup steps.
- If any regular steps fail the replay will stop and any Cleanup steps will not be executed.
suggestions.suggested_text:
Cleanup Steps Configuration:
1. Display Section: Cleanup steps will appear in a dedicated section below regular steps.
2. Tooltips: Display tooltips in the Cleanup steps section as per design guidelines.
3. Insert Menu: Enable the insert (+) menu in the Cleanup steps section for adding new steps.

Step Management:
1. Marking Steps: Allow marking of regular steps as cleanup steps via the scenario editor. Marked steps will move to the beginning of the Cleanup steps section.
2. Unmarking Steps: Allow conversion of cleanup steps back to regular steps, which will then move to the end of the regular steps section.
3. Restrictions: Prevent marking of Step Groups or SGA as cleanup steps.
4. Rearrangement and Drag-and-Drop: Enable rearrangement within the Cleanup steps section and between regular and cleanup sections. Show an error modal for non-eligible steps.

Interface Options:
1. Step Counter: Display a breakdown of regular and cleanup steps on mouseover in the scenario edit screen.
2. Options Tab: Introduce an Options tab to manage visibility of Cleanup Steps, Data, and Variables tabs. Disable hiding if any active elements are present.

Execution Rules:
1. Local Replay: Continue with cleanup steps if all regular steps pass. Stop execution if any regular step fails.
2. Export Values: Enable cleanup steps to export values during execution.
suggestions.explanation: The original text contains a complex, lengthy description of the requirements for the 'On the Scenario Details Screen' which can be overwhelming and hard to follow. The suggested text breaks down these requirements into categorized, concise, and actionable sub-sections, enhancing clarity and readability.

suggestions.suggested_text: Define specific error messages for each scenario where a user attempts to drag and drop non-eligible steps into the Cleanup Steps section. Include error handling for network issues, permission errors, and other exceptions that may occur during the drag and drop operation.
suggestions.explanation: Expanding the error handling requirements ensures that developers and testers have clear guidelines on how to handle various exceptions, leading to a more robust and user-friendly feature.

suggestions.suggested_text: Specify the behavior and error messages for scenarios where cleanup steps fail during test execution. Include details on how the system should respond, whether the test should continue with other steps, and how these failures are logged and reported to the user.
suggestions.explanation: Providing detailed error handling procedures for cleanup step failures during tests will help in developing a clear and predictable user experience, ensuring that users understand the impact of such failures on their test results.

suggestions.suggested_text: Include error handling guidelines for scenarios where cleanup steps cannot be executed due to system constraints or configuration issues. Define fallback procedures and notifications to inform users about the issue.
suggestions.explanation: Clarifying how the system should handle situations where cleanup steps cannot be executed will help in maintaining system stability and providing users with immediate feedback on operational issues.

suggestions.original_text:
- Number of created cleanup steps
- Number of customers with cleanup steps enabled
- Number of scenarios with cleanup steps enabled
- Outcome Metrics
	- The feature is used by 10% of eligible customers after 3 months
- Any Feedback received from current and demo customers about this feature.
- Scenarios with Cleanup steps see increased run frequency over non-cleanup scenarios
suggestions.suggested_text:
- Number of created cleanup steps: Target to reach 5000 cleanup steps created within the first quarter post-launch.
- Number of customers with cleanup steps enabled: Aim for at least 30% of active customers to enable this feature within six months.
- Number of scenarios with cleanup steps enabled: Target at least 1000 scenarios to utilize cleanup steps by the end of the first quarter.
- Outcome Metrics:
	- Achieve a user adoption rate of 15% of eligible customers within the first three months post-launch.
	- Increase customer retention by 5% year-over-year attributed to the introduction of cleanup steps.
- Collect and analyze feedback from at least 50 customers within the first two months to guide further enhancements.
- Measure the frequency of scenario runs with cleanup steps and aim for a 20% increase compared to those without.
suggestions.explanation: The original text lacks specific, measurable goals which are essential for tracking the success of the feature. The suggested text provides clear, quantifiable targets and metrics that can be used to evaluate the feature's impact and effectiveness post-release.

suggestions.location: Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version) (line 1-2)
suggestions.original_text: Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version)
suggestions.suggested_text: Technical proposal (detailed content integrated below)
suggestions.explanation: Replacing the reference to an external document with a directive to integrate the content directly into the PRD ensures consistency and accessibility of all relevant information in one place.

suggestions.original_text: Roadmap Schedule Q3 2023 - Design Estimate - Engineering Estimate 5 sprints [Cleanup Steps: Rough Time Estimate](https://www.notion.so/Cleanup-Steps-Rough-Time-Estimate-e0ac287399e047889af858aba00736e3?pvs=21) **Updated after design change (3/17)
suggestions.suggested_text:
Roadmap Schedule: Q3 2023
Design Phase Start: July 1, 2023
Design Phase End: July 31, 2023
Engineering Phase Start: August 1, 2023
Engineering Phase End: December 15, 2023
Engineering Sprints: 5 sprints, each lasting 2 weeks
Detailed Time Estimates: [Cleanup Steps: Detailed Time Estimate](https://www.notion.so/Cleanup-Steps-Detailed-Time-Estimate-e0ac287399e047889af858aba00736e3?pvs=21)
suggestions.explanation: The original text lacks specific dates and detailed estimates for the design and engineering phases. The suggested text provides clear start and end dates for each phase and links to a detailed time estimate to resolve the issue identified.

issues.resolution: Elaborate on the 'Documentation' section by specifying what specific documentation needs to be updated or created, including user manuals, help articles, and internal documentation.

suggestions.suggested_text:
Overview/Problem Statement

Users often create steps in their tests that involve the creation of new user data or other data within a test scenario. However, once a test is complete, they do not want this data to remain in the system. The main concern is to ensure that temporary data used during testing does not persist in the system, which could lead to clutter or misuse of data. The cleanup steps feature aims to address this by allowing users to define steps that specifically target and remove this data post-testing.
suggestions.explanation: The original 'Overview/Problem Statement' section was incomplete and did not provide a clear explanation of the problem. The suggested text elaborates on the issue, explaining the need for cleanup steps in test scenarios to ensure temporary data does not persist post-testing, thus providing clarity and context to the document.

suggestions.original_text: We had 3 customers give us specific feedback with needs regarding cleanup steps and decided not to go with us because of it. I think we could have closed at least 2 more customers for $900 MRR with some more features to solve these issues.
suggestions.suggested_text: The introduction of enhanced cleanup steps is directly driven by feedback from potential customers. Three prospects highlighted the absence of robust cleanup functionalities as a dealbreaker. By addressing these gaps, we anticipate not only improving our product's competitiveness but also potentially increasing our monthly recurring revenue by approximately $900 through securing clients who prioritize such features.
suggestions.explanation: The original text lacks a clear and compelling value proposition. The suggested text clarifies the direct impact of customer feedback on product development and quantifies the potential business benefits, making the value proposition more specific and persuasive.

suggestions.suggested_text:
Requirements

Functional Requirements:
1. Provide a dedicated UI section for cleanup steps in the scenario details screen.
2. Allow users to mark regular steps as cleanup steps and vice versa.
3. Enable drag-and-drop functionality for organizing cleanup steps.
4. Display error messages for invalid operations on cleanup steps.
5. Implement a toggle in the scenario editor for showing or hiding the cleanup steps section.

Non-Functional Requirements:
1. The UI changes must be responsive and compatible with existing design frameworks.
2. Ensure that the feature can handle scenarios with up to 100 steps without performance degradation.
3. Provide clear error messaging that is consistent with the current application's standards.
4. Ensure that all functionalities are accessible according to WCAG 2.1 AA standards.
suggestions.explanation: The original 'Requirements' section is vague and lacks specific details necessary for developers and testers to implement and verify the feature correctly. The suggested text adds clear functional and non-functional requirements that outline what needs to be developed and how the system should perform, ensuring a more straightforward and effective implementation and testing process.

suggestions.original_text:
- As a user, I want to convert the recorded steps into the cleanup steps
- As a user, I want to see the cleanup steps execution result in the test scenario results page
suggestions.suggested_text:
- As a user, I want to convert the recorded steps into cleanup steps by selecting the 'Convert to Cleanup' option in the scenario editor, ensuring that these steps are designated for post-test cleanup.
- As a user, I want to view the execution results of cleanup steps in the test scenario results page, where cleanup steps are distinctly marked and their outcomes (pass/fail) are clearly displayed.
suggestions.explanation: The original text lacks detail on how users can convert steps into cleanup steps and how they can view these steps' results. The suggested text provides a clearer, step-by-step description of the user interactions and expected outcomes, which is essential for proper understanding and test case generation.

suggestions.original_text:
- Data staging / before hook ( __cleanup__ ), we will focus on the __cleanup_only__ as in the existing cleanup functionality.
- Cleanup steps can be in the middle of a scenario
- Toggle cleanup steps in the recorder
- Cleanup steps inside a step group
- Step groups can be marked as cleanup steps
suggestions.suggested_text:
- Data staging / before hook ( __cleanup__ ), we will focus on the __cleanup_only__ as in the existing cleanup functionality.
- Cleanup steps can be in the middle of a scenario
- Toggle cleanup steps in the recorder
- Cleanup steps inside a step group
- Step groups can be marked as cleanup steps
- Integration with third-party tools for data validation
- Automatic rollback of database changes post-test execution
- Support for cleanup in mobile app testing scenarios
suggestions.explanation: The 'Not in Scope' section is updated to include additional features and functionalities that are explicitly excluded from the current scope of the project, providing clearer boundaries and expectations.

suggestions.original_text:
- Workspace manager and editor would have access to all functionality in this feature.
	- User Roles Permission Matrix -

[https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mdXM7kOSGYbrWY2](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mdXM7kOSGYbrWY2-kZGF6FFA6OIBsrimSd8gA2KgEUU/edit#gid=613193027&range=B13) [kZGF6FFA6OIBsrimSd8gA2KgEUU/edit#gid=613193027&range=B13](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mdXM7kOSGYbrWY2-kZGF6FFA6OIBsrimSd8gA2KgEUU/edit#gid=613193027&range=B13)
suggestions.suggested_text:
- Workspace manager and editor would have access to all functionality in this feature. Detailed permissions for each role are as follows:
  - Workspace Manager: Can enable/disable cleanup steps, edit all scenarios, and view all test results.
  - Editor: Can edit scenarios and view test results, but cannot enable/disable cleanup steps.
  - Viewer: Can only view scenarios and test results, no edit permissions.
  - For a comprehensive matrix of user roles and permissions, refer to the User Roles Permission Matrix here: [User Roles Permission Matrix](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1mdXM7kOSGYbrWY2-kZGF6FFA6OIBsrimSd8gA2KgEUU/edit#gid=613193027&range=B13)
suggestions.explanation: The original text lacks specific details about what each user role can do within the feature. The suggested text provides clear and detailed descriptions of the access controls and permissions for different user roles, enhancing understanding and compliance.

suggestions.original_text:
- Number of created cleanup steps
- Number of customers with cleanup steps enabled
- Number of scenarios with cleanup steps enabled
- Outcome Metrics
	- The feature is used by 10% of eligible customers after 3 months
- Any Feedback received from current and demo customers about this feature.
- Scenarios with Cleanup steps see increased run frequency over non-cleanup scenarios
suggestions.suggested_text:
- Number of created cleanup steps per month
- Percentage of customers with cleanup steps enabled out of total customers
- Number of scenarios with cleanup steps enabled per customer
- Outcome Metrics
	- Achieve a usage rate of 10% among eligible customers within 3 months post-launch
	- Increase customer retention by 5% due to the implementation of cleanup steps within 6 months
- Collect and analyze feedback from at least 30% of users utilizing the cleanup steps within the first 2 months post-release
- Scenarios with Cleanup steps should demonstrate a 15% higher run frequency compared to non-cleanup scenarios within the first 4 months
suggestions.explanation: The suggested metrics are specific, measurable, achievable, relevant, and time-bound (SMART), providing clear targets and timelines for assessing the success of the cleanup steps feature.

suggestions.original_text: Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version)
suggestions.suggested_text: Technical proposal: Please refer to the detailed technical document for the latest version, which includes comprehensive information on the technical architecture, data flow, and integration points necessary for implementation.
suggestions.explanation: The original text directs to another document without providing context or detail. The suggested text clarifies that the technical document contains necessary detailed information, making it clear what to expect from the referenced document.

suggestions.suggested_text:
Roadmap Schedule Q3 2023: 
- Initial design phase completion by end of July 2023. 
- Development phase from August to mid-September 2023. 
- Testing phase from mid-September to end of September 2023. 
- Final review and adjustments in early October 2023. 
- Projected release date: October 15, 2023.
suggestions.explanation: The original text provides only a vague timeline. The suggested text offers a detailed breakdown of each phase within the quarter, providing clearer expectations and aiding in project management and stakeholder communication.

suggestions.suggested_text: Design Estimate: Approximately 150 hours needed to complete all design tasks, including wireframes, high-fidelity mockups, and user interface adjustments.
suggestions.explanation: The original text leaves the design estimate blank. Providing a specific number of hours for the design tasks helps in resource planning and gives stakeholders a clearer understanding of the time investment required.

suggestions.suggested_text: Engineering Estimate: 5 sprints, each sprint lasting two weeks, totaling 10 weeks of development time. This includes coding, integration, and initial testing phases.
suggestions.explanation: The original text mentions '5 sprints' without context. Expanding this to include the duration of each sprint and what will be accomplished provides more detailed and actionable information for project planning.

suggestions.original_text:
Review the user stories
Check whether bug bash is required or not
suggestions.suggested_text:
Review the user stories
Check whether bug bash is required or not
Verify all new functionalities as per the PRD
Ensure cross-browser compatibility
Validate data integrity and error handling
Conduct performance testing
Review security and compliance measures
Prepare test reports and document findings
suggestions.explanation: The original checklist is too brief and lacks comprehensive steps necessary for thorough QA testing. The suggested text includes additional essential activities to ensure the feature is tested comprehensively for functionality, performance, security, and compliance.

suggestions.suggested_text:
Checklist for CS team
- Review the new feature documentation thoroughly.
- Prepare FAQs for common issues related to the new cleanup steps feature.
- Update internal support scripts to include troubleshooting steps for the cleanup steps feature.
- Schedule a training session for all CS team members to understand the new feature deeply.
- Ensure all team members have access to the latest product updates and feature releases.
- Set up a direct line of communication with the product team to report and resolve any critical issues encountered by users.
suggestions.explanation: The original section lacks detailed steps and procedures for the CS team to follow post-release. The suggested text provides a comprehensive checklist that prepares the CS team to assist users effectively with the new feature.

suggestions.suggested_text: Documentation needs to include user manuals detailing the new cleanup steps feature, help articles on how to use cleanup steps effectively, and internal documentation for training customer support and sales teams.
suggestions.explanation: The current 'Documentation' section lacks specific details on what documents need to be updated or created. Providing a clear list of required documentation ensures comprehensive support and understanding of the new features.

issues.description: Markdown table formatting issues due to line breaks within cells, which may cause parsing difficulties for an LLM.
locations: Line 2-8: Table with creation and last edited details
issues.resolution: Remove unnecessary line breaks within table cells to ensure proper markdown table formatting. Consolidate information into single lines where possible.

issues.description: Use of emojis and special characters in markdown which might not be uniformly interpreted or rendered by different markdown parsers or LLMs.
locations: Line 6: Status column contains an emoji
issues.resolution: Replace emojis and special characters with plain text descriptions to ensure uniform interpretation across different platforms and parsers.

issues.description: Links are broken across multiple lines, which could lead to incorrect URL parsing and linking errors.
issues.resolution: Ensure that URLs are not broken across lines. Use markdown's ability to handle long URLs or use URL shorteners if necessary to keep links intact within a single line.

issues.description: Ambiguous references and lack of explicit detail in requirements which might lead to misinterpretation.
locations: Requirements section: Vague statements like 'Tooltips to be shown in the Cleanup steps section as per the design.' without specific details on tooltip content or triggers.
issues.resolution: Provide explicit details for vague references in the requirements. For example, specify exactly what content or triggers should be included in tooltips within the Cleanup steps section.

issues.description: Inconsistent formatting and unclear separation of sections, which could confuse both human readers and LLMs.
locations: Throughout the document: Inconsistent use of headers and subheaders, mixed use of lists and prose for requirements.
issues.resolution: Standardize the formatting throughout the document. Use consistent headers and subheaders, and clearly separate sections using markdown formatting tools like horizontal rules or distinct headings.

issues.description: Unclear references to external documents without explicit context or summary within the PRD, which might lead to incomplete understanding if those documents are not accessible.
locations: Technical proposal section references an external technical document for the latest version without summarizing key points.
issues.resolution: Include a brief summary of key points from external documents directly in the PRD to ensure understanding even if external documents are not accessible.

issues.description: Use of non-standard markdown syntax or placeholders that might not be rendered correctly in all markdown viewers.
locations: Page 7-3: Documentation section contains an image placeholder that might not resolve correctly.
issues.resolution: Replace non-standard markdown syntax or placeholders with standard markdown elements or provide alternative text descriptions if images or other content cannot be displayed.

suggestions.explanation: Removing the line breaks within the table cells ensures that the markdown table is properly formatted and easier to parse.

suggestions.explanation: The original statement lacks detail on what the error modal should contain. Adding specifics about including the reason for the error enhances clarity and user understanding.

suggestions.suggested_text: Specify the error message to be shown in the test results if cleanup steps cannot be executed, ensuring it clearly differentiates from other types of errors.
suggestions.explanation: The document currently does not specify what the error message should say, leading to potential confusion. Adding a detailed description of the error message will clarify what users should expect to see.

suggestions.explanation: The original text does not explain how the toggle affects the feature's availability or user access. Providing this detail helps in understanding the impact of enabling or disabling the feature.

suggestions.location: Technical proposal (go the technical document to get latest version)
suggestions.suggested_text: While the detailed technical specifications are available in the external document, key aspects include database modifications for cleanup step tracking, backend adjustments for cleanup step management, and frontend updates for displaying cleanup steps distinctly from regular steps.
suggestions.explanation: Adding a brief summary of the external technical document directly in the PRD ensures that readers can grasp essential information even if they do not access the external document.

suggestions.suggested_text: ![Documentation Changes](URL_to_image)
suggestions.explanation: The original image placeholder might not resolve correctly in all markdown viewers. Replacing it with a standard markdown image syntax with a placeholder URL and a descriptive alt text ensures better compatibility and accessibility.

issues.description: Contradictory information about whether step groups can be marked as cleanup steps.
locations: Step groups can be marked as cleanup steps (line 4-0)
Step groups or SGA should NOT be able to be marked or pasted as Cleanup steps (page-1-2)
issues.resolution: Clarify in the PRD that step groups or SGA should not be marked or pasted as Cleanup steps. Update all references in the document to be consistent with this rule.

issues.description: Unclear requirement on the execution of cleanup steps when regular steps fail.
locations: If any regular steps fail the replay will stop and any Cleanup steps will not be executed (page-1-3)
If the cleanup steps cannot be executed a specific error message should be shown in test results (page-3-1)
issues.resolution: Revise the PRD to specify that if any regular steps fail, the replay will stop and Cleanup steps will not be executed, but a specific error message related to the failure of Cleanup steps will be shown in the test results.

issues.description: Inconsistent information about the visibility and functionality of cleanup steps when the feature is disabled in admin settings.
locations: Any existing cleanup steps will not be visible in scenario editor (page-3-2)
Previous test runs with cleanup steps will still be visible in test results detail screen (page-3-2)
issues.resolution: Update the PRD to consistently state that when the Cleanup steps feature is disabled in admin settings, any existing Cleanup steps will not be visible or functional in the scenario editor, but previous test runs with Cleanup steps will still be visible in the test results detail screen.

issues.description: Unclear and potentially conflicting information about the handling of cleanup steps in test results.
locations: Tests with failed cleanup steps will just be marked as failed as per regular steps failing (page-9-2)
Can we mark tests as specific with 'cleanup failed' rather than just failed (page-10-3)
issues.resolution: Standardize the handling of test results involving Cleanup steps across the PRD. Specify that tests with failed Cleanup steps will be marked as failed, and consider adding a specific 'cleanup failed' badge in future updates for clearer differentiation.

issues.description: Ambiguity in the design mockup links, with broken or repeated links.
locations: Design mockup links are repeated and some are broken (page-3-4)
issues.resolution: Correct and consolidate the design mockup links in the PRD. Ensure all links are functional and direct to the intended design files without repetition.

issues.description: Unclear handling of scenarios where all steps are cleanup steps.
locations: What if all a user creates an all clean up scenario? (page-10-2)
issues.resolution: Define the expected behavior and handling of scenarios where all steps are Cleanup steps in the PRD. This should include how these scenarios are executed and displayed in the UI.

issues.description: Inconsistency in the documentation about whether cleanup steps can be in the middle of a scenario.
locations: Cleanup steps can be in the middle of a scenario (page-4-0)
Cleanup steps can be added in run in the middle of scenarios or not? (page-10-3)
issues.resolution: Clarify in the PRD that Cleanup steps cannot be placed in the middle of a scenario. Ensure all references in the document align with this rule and remove any contradictory statements.

suggestions.original_text: Step groups can be marked as cleanup steps
suggestions.suggested_text: Step groups cannot be marked as cleanup steps
suggestions.explanation: To resolve the contradiction and align with the specified rules that step groups or SGA should not be marked or pasted as Cleanup steps.

suggestions.original_text: Step groups can be marked as cleanup steps
suggestions.suggested_text: Step groups cannot be marked as cleanup steps
suggestions.explanation: To ensure consistency throughout the document and to avoid confusion, it's necessary to clarify that step groups cannot be marked as cleanup steps.

suggestions.original_text: If any regular steps fail the replay will stop and any Cleanup steps will not be executed.
suggestions.suggested_text: If any regular steps fail, the replay will stop, and Cleanup steps will not be executed. A specific error message related to the failure of Cleanup steps will be shown in the test results.
suggestions.explanation: Clarifies the behavior when regular steps fail, ensuring that the error handling for Cleanup steps is explicitly mentioned.

suggestions.original_text: If the cleanup steps cannot be executed a specific error message should be shown in test results
suggestions.suggested_text: If the cleanup steps cannot be executed due to the failure of regular steps, a specific error message related to the failure of Cleanup steps will be shown in the test results.
suggestions.explanation: Enhances clarity by specifying that the error message is shown when Cleanup steps cannot be executed due to earlier failures in regular steps.

suggestions.location: Line referring to visibility of cleanup steps when disabled in admin settings
suggestions.original_text: Any existing cleanup steps will not be visible in scenario editor
suggestions.suggested_text: Any existing cleanup steps will not be visible or functional in the scenario editor
suggestions.explanation: Clarifies that not only will the cleanup steps not be visible, they will also not be functional when the feature is disabled, ensuring consistency with the functionality described for test results detail screen.

suggestions.location: Line referring to visibility of cleanup steps in test results when disabled in admin settings
suggestions.original_text: Previous test runs with cleanup steps will still be visible in test results detail screen.
suggestions.suggested_text: Previous test runs with cleanup steps will still be visible and their results accessible in the test results detail screen.
suggestions.explanation: Enhances clarity by specifying that not only will previous test runs be visible, but their detailed results will also be accessible, maintaining a consistent approach to how cleanup steps are handled post feature disablement.

suggestions.original_text: Remove the new Cleanup failed badge, tests with failed cleanup steps will just be marked as failed as per regular steps failing
suggestions.suggested_text: Maintain the new Cleanup failed badge, tests with failed cleanup steps will be marked with a specific 'cleanup failed' badge for clearer differentiation.
suggestions.explanation: This change ensures clarity and consistency in how test results are reported when cleanup steps fail, aligning with the need for specific identification of cleanup step failures.

suggestions.original_text: Can we mark tests as specific with 'cleanup failed' rather than just failed.
suggestions.suggested_text: Implement marking tests with specific 'cleanup failed' rather than just failed to provide clear and actionable feedback on the nature of the test failure.
suggestions.explanation: This adjustment provides a specific designation for failures due to cleanup steps, enhancing the understanding and troubleshooting of test results.

suggestions.explanation: The original text contains broken and repeated links to the design mockup. This suggestion consolidates the link into a single, correct URL and removes redundancy, ensuring clarity and functionality.

This line contains a broken link that is incorrectly formatted and split into parts. Removing this link as it appears to be a duplicate of the previously corrected link, which simplifies the document and avoids confusion.

suggestions.suggested_text: Define the behavior and handling of scenarios where all steps are marked as Cleanup steps. These scenarios should be executed and displayed in the UI with clear differentiation from regular scenarios. This includes any special rules or exceptions that apply to all-cleanup scenarios.
suggestions.explanation: This addition clarifies how the system should handle scenarios composed entirely of cleanup steps, ensuring consistent and predictable behavior.

suggestions.original_text: Cleanup steps can be in the middle of a scenario
suggestions.suggested_text: Cleanup steps cannot be in the middle of a scenario
suggestions.explanation: To resolve the inconsistency and align with the decision that cleanup steps should not be placed in the middle of a scenario.

suggestions.original_text: Cleanup steps can be added in run in the middle of scenarios or not?
suggestions.suggested_text: Cleanup steps cannot be added in the middle of scenarios during a run.
suggestions.explanation: To clarify and ensure consistency throughout the document that cleanup steps are not to be placed in the middle of scenarios.
